Class BuildingCommand

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.Command
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.BuildingCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BuildingCommand extends Command implements Serializable
BuildingCommand represents a specific type of command that is used for managing and executing actions related to building operations in the game. It extends the generic Command class and implements the Serializable interface. This class encapsulates data about the building operation, such as coordinates, rotation, and position, along with the game and player context. It also defines the logic for executing the command based on the building-related operation specified. The command type for this class is defined as "BuildingCommand".
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BuildingCommand

      public BuildingCommand()
      Constructs a new BuildingCommand instance with default parameters. This constructor initializes a BuildingCommand object without setting specific values for its fields. The BuildingCommand class represents a command in the game that allows players to construct or place a building at designated coordinates with a specified rotation and position. This command is part of the game's command system and extends the Command base class. This default constructor may serve as a placeholder or be used in scenarios where a BuildingCommand object needs to be initialized prior to being configured with specific details.

    • BuildingCommand

      public BuildingCommand(int x, int y, int rotation, int position, String gameId, String playerId, int lv, String title, String token)
      Constructs a new BuildingCommand instance, initializing its parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate for the building placement
      y - the y-coordinate for the building placement
      rotation - the rotation of the building
      position - the position or index of the building
      gameId - the unique identifier for the game
      playerId - the unique identifier for the player issuing the command
      lv - the level or stage of the game
      title - the title or name of the command
      token - a unique token for authentication or tracking

    • execute

      public void execute(Player player) throws RemoteException, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException, IllegalStateException
      Executes the building command for the given player based on the specific action title.
      Specified by:
      execute in class Command
      Parameters:
      player - The player on which the command is executed.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote invocation error occurs.
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - If there is an error processing JSON data.
      IllegalStateException - If the command is executed in an invalid state.
